##Creating a Map of the Great Basin with interactive layers 

```{r}
library(sf)
library(raster)
library(leaflet)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
install.packages("maps")

#MAP

leaflet() %>% 
  addTiles() %>%
  setView(-117.035, 39.483, zoom = 6) %>% 
  addProviderTiles(providers$OpenTopoMap, group = "Topo View") %>% 
  addProviderTiles(providers$Esri.WorldImagery, group = "Satelite View") %>%
  addProviderTiles(providers$Esri.WorldPhysical, group = "Physical View") %>% 
  addPolygons(data = gb3) %>% 
  addPolygons(data = states2) %>% 
  
  addLayersControl(
    baseGroups = c("Topo View", "Satelite View"),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = T))
  
  
  
  
  

library(maps)
mapStates = map("state", fill = FALSE, plot = FALSE)
leaflet(data = mapStates) %>% addTiles() %>%
  addPolygons(fillColor = topo.colors(10, alpha = NULL), stroke = FALSE)


library(rgdal)
states <- readOGR(dsn = "shapes/cb_2016_us_state_20m.shp",
  layer = "cb_2016_us_state_20m", GDAL1_integer64_policy = FALSE)

#great basin hydrogreographic outline:

gb <- st_read(dsn = "shapes/ha694c_ha1000gb_shapefile", layer = "ha1000gb_l")

gb2 <- st_transform(gb, 4326)

gb3 <- st_combine(gb2)

gb4 <- st_union(gb3, by_feature = TRUE)

class(gb4)

plot(gb4)

library(sf)



states <- sf::st_read("shapes/cb_2016_us_state_20m.shp")

states2 <- st_transform(states, 4326)
```
